topics.body: I really wish for a official Hasbro fighting game. That would be so cool.

topics.body:
Good god does this take forever; what I'm doing right now is updating my laptop so I can play league on it.  The reason why it's taking so long is that it has a non-pae cpu and it's still on 12.04 cause I forgot to update it so it's having to saved the installed packages which is taking forever on top of installing it.

Tl:dr; my laptop is old so it's taking a long time to upgrade.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Shadow_the_Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e6dab86368727b9a010000#post_53e6dab86368727b9a010000
That could do too.

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e6da2563687203270c0100#post_53e6da2563687203270c0100
Problem is, Hasbro has built its reputation as a _children's company_ for many years. And partly because of how their traditional audiences that they equally don't want to lose have parents who'd bitch about kids media "turning into teen and adult media" if they ever try to cater towards us too much.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e6dc4d6368725e67900000#post_53e6dc4d6368725e67900000
Thus why Hasbro's fucked in the long run financially and will probably be bought out eventually.  If I remember correctly they took in only 80million last year vs the nearly 400million they took in 2009(wait correction; they took in 375million in 2009).  That's quite a large drop in profits in only a couple years.
